summary: Congress funded $47 billion in grants for renters unable to pay rent or utilities during the COVID-19 pandemic. Treasury disbursed the grants to state and local governments, which then paid renters, landlords, and utility providers. To expedite payments, Treasury introduced flexibilities—for example, allowing renters to self-attest their eligibility instead of providing documentation when applying for funds. But, Treasury hasn't implemented monitoring procedures needed to manage...
title: Emergency Rental Assistance: Additional Grantee Monitoring Needed to Manage Known Risks
